meanings.definition: Opposed to or against popular opinion or sentiment.
meanings.sent1: The antipopular movie received mixed reviews from the audience.
meanings.sent2: Her antipopular views on the topic made her stand out in the group.
meanings.sent3: It was quite antipopular to suggest a different approach, but it turned out to be the right decision.
meanings.sent4: His antipopular stance on the issue was like a lone tree standing tall in a field of conformity.
meanings.sent5: The antipopular choice she made that day changed her life forever.

meanings.definition: Not conforming to the tastes or preferences of the general public.
meanings.sent1: The artist's antipopular style was not appreciated by everyone.
meanings.sent2: The antipopular music genre was loved by a niche group of fans.
meanings.sent3: Wearing that antipopular outfit to the party was a bold move.
meanings.sent4: Her antipopular taste in books was like a hidden gem waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The antipopular restaurant served dishes that challenged traditional flavors.
